edu.umn.galaxyp

Class ValidateFastaDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umn.galaxyp.ValidateFastaDatabase

  • public class ValidateFastaDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to run checks on FASTA database. Main entry point to program.

    • Method Detail

      • addDatabaseType

        public void addDatabaseType(Header.DatabaseType value)

      • getDatabaseTypeMultiSet

        public MultiSet<Header.DatabaseType> getDatabaseTypeMultiSet()

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        runs checks on supplied FASTA database
        Parameters:
        args - array of command line arguments in the following order:
        1. path to input FASTA database
        2. path to output valid FASTA entries
        3. path to output invalid FASTA entries
        4. boolean; if true, crash if any entries have invalid headers. default is false
        5. boolean; if true, check that each entry is a amino acid sequence. default is true.
        6. boolean; if true, add characters to AA alphabet. default is false.
        7. string: if 6) is true, characters to add to AA alphabet. default is "" (empty string)
        8. boolean; if true, check that each entry is associated with an accession number. default is false
        9. boolean; if true, check that each entry's sequence is above a minimum length. default is false.
        10. int; if 9) is true, will filter out any sequences with lengths below this length. default is 0

      • passAccession

        public boolean passAccession(boolean checkHasAccession,
                             FastaRecord current_record)
        checks if we should filter out FASTA database entries without accession numbers
        Parameters:
        checkHasAccession - true if checking for a successful accession number parsing
        current_record - FASTA database entry currently in memory
        Returns:
        true either if 1) we don't want to check for a valid accession number or 2) sequence has a valid accession number

      • passBelowMinimumLength

        public boolean passBelowMinimumLength(boolean checkLength,
                                      int minimumLength,
                                      FastaRecord current_record)
        checks if we should check for length, and if so, checks length
        Parameters:
        checkLength - true if running length check
        minimumLength - if running length check, length of sequence is compared to this number
        current_record - FASTA database entry currently in memory
        Returns:
        true either if 1) we don't want to check for length, or 2) sequence is above minimum length

      • passDnaOrRna

        public boolean passDnaOrRna(boolean checkIsProtein,
                            FastaRecord current_record)
        should we check if the sequence is a valid protein sequence?
        Parameters:
        checkIsProtein - if true, run check against DNA and RNA alphabets
        current_record - FASTA database entry currently in memory
        Returns:
        true either if 1) we don't want to check if sequence is valid, or 2) sequence is a valid AA sequence

      • readAndWriteFASTAHeader

        public void readAndWriteFASTAHeader(java.nio.file.Path inPath,
                                    boolean crash_if_invalid,
                                    java.nio.file.Path outPathGood,
                                    java.nio.file.Path outPathBad,
                                    boolean checkIsProtein,
                                    boolean checkLength,
                                    int minimumLength,
                                    boolean checkHasAccession)
        takes path to header, reads in FASTA file, and writes out sorted FASTA
        Parameters:
        inPath - path to FASTA file to be read in(NIO Path object)
        crash_if_invalid - if true, a badly formatted header (the first) will immediately cause a System.exit(1)
        checkLength -
        minimumLength -
        checkHasAccession -
